text: Check vector values NAs least two non-NA values. , return vector indices NA values case. none found, return NULL.

title: Get NA values between non-NA values — get_na_between_non_na
Get NA values between non-NA values — get_na_between_non_na
text: x vector values.

title: Get NA values between non-NA values — get_na_between_non_na
text: vector numeric indices NA values least two non-NA values. Returns NULL none found.

title: Get NA values between non-NA values — get_na_between_non_na
text: can e.g. conveniently used test whether BLQ samples -two numeric (LOQ) values. Within single PK curve likely occur individual data point flagged outlier.

title: Get NA values between non-NA values — get_na_between_non_na
code: get_na_between_non_na(c(NA, 1, 2, NA, 4, NA, 6, NA, NA, 9, NA)) #> [1] 4 6 8 9

what: Test if a vector of values is likely to be continuous or categorical — is_continuous
title: Test if a vector of values is likely to be continuous or categorical — is_continuous
text: function try convert values numeric. certain fraction values able convert successfully, assume vector continuous. Default threshold 0.8.

Test if a vector of values is likely to be continuous or categorical — is_continuous
text: x vector values cutoff cutoff value 0 1 deciding continuous/categorical. Default threshold 0.8.

title: Test if a vector of values is likely to be continuous or categorical — is_continuous
text: TRUE vector values likely continuous, otherwise FALSE.

title: Test if a vector of values is likely to be continuous or categorical — is_continuous
text: function try convert values numeric. certain fraction values able convert successfully, assume vector continuous.

title: Test if a vector of values is likely to be continuous or categorical — is_continuous
code: is_continuous(1:3) #> [1] TRUE is_continuous(c(1, 3, 5)) #> [1] TRUE is_continuous(c("a", 1)) #> [1] FALSE

Safe relational operators — %>=%
text: Binary operators allow comparison values atomic vectors, little room floating point precision issues.

text: x, y Numeric vectors.

title: Safe relational operators — %>=%
text: logical vector indicating result element element comparison.

title: Safe relational operators — %>=%
text: binary comparison operators make base relational operators (base::Comparison) safer adding little room floating point precision issues. %>=% counterpart >=, %<=% counterpart <=.
